memberdef.name: NRFX_QSPI_DEFAULT_CONFIG
memberdef.initializer: { \ .xip_offset = 0, \ .pins = { \ .sck_pin = _pin_sck, \ .csn_pin = _pin_csn, \ .io0_pin = _pin_io0, \ .io1_pin = _pin_io1, \ .io2_pin = _pin_io2, \ .io3_pin = _pin_io3 \ }, \ .prot_if = { \ .readoc = NRF_QSPI_READOC_FASTREAD, \ .writeoc = NRF_QSPI_WRITEOC_PP, \ .addrmode = NRF_QSPI_ADDRMODE_24BIT, \ .dpmconfig = false, \ }, \ .phy_if = { \ .sck_delay = 0x05, \ .dpmen = false, \ .spi_mode = NRF_QSPI_MODE_0, \ .sck_freq = NRF_QSPI_FREQ_DIV16, \ }, \ .timeout = 500, \ .irq_priority = (uint8_t)NRFX_QSPI_DEFAULT_CONFIG_IRQ_PRIORITY, \ }

briefdescription.para: QSPI instance default configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
This configuration sets up QSPI with the following options:
no offset for address in the external memory for Execute in Place operation
single data line
FAST_READ opcode for reading
PP opcode for writing
24 bit addressing mode
Deep Power-down disabled
clock frequency: 2 MHz for nRF52 Series, 6 MHz for nRF53 Series
SCK delay 5 clock ticks
500 milliseconds operation timeout
mode 0 (data captured on the clock rising edge and transmitted on a falling edge. Clock base level is '0')

parameterdescription.para: Pin for clock signal.
Pin for chip select signal.
Pin 0 for I/O data.
Pin 1 for I/O data.
Pin 2 for I/O data.
Pin 3 for I/O data.

briefdescription.para: QSPI custom instruction helper with the default configuration.
QSPI master driver event types, passed to the handler routine provided during initialization.
QSPI master driver extended event types, obtained using nrfx_qspi_event_extended_get() function.
QSPI driver event handler type.
Function for initializing the QSPI driver instance.

detaileddescription.para: This function configures the peripheral and its interrupts.

The function does not activate the peripheral instance. The activation is done during the first transfer after initialization or when calling nrfx_qspi_activate function. The activation process starts the internal clocks, and the QSPI peripheral tries to read the status byte to check the busy bit. Reading the status byte is done in a simple poll and wait mechanism. If the busy bit is set, this indicates issues with the external memory device. As a result, transfer functions return NRFX_ERROR_TIMEOUT.
In case of issues:
Check the connection.
Make sure that the memory device does not perform other operations like erasing or writing.
Check if there is a short circuit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure with the initial configuration.
Event handler provided by the user. If NULL, transfers will be performed in blocking mode.
Pointer to context. Use in the interrupt handler.

simplesect.para: On nRF5340, only the dedicated pins with NRF_GPIO_PIN_SEL_PERIPHERAL configuration are supported. See the chapter Pin assignments in the Product Specification.

parameterdescription.para: Initialization was successful.
The driver is already initialized.
The driver is already initialized. Deprecated - use NRFX_ERROR_ALREADY instead.
The pin configuration was incorrect.

briefdescription.para: Function for reconfiguring the QSPI driver instance.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure with the configuration.

simplesect.para: The function deactivates the peripheral instance. The activation is done during the first transfer after reconfiguration or when calling nrfx_qspi_activate function.

parameterdescription.para: Reconfiguration was successful.
The driver is during transaction.
External memory is busy or there are connection issues.
The driver is uninitialized.
The pin configuration was incorrect.

briefdescription.para: Function for uninitializing the QSPI driver instance.

simplesect.para: If a custom instruction long transfer is ongoing when the function is called, the transfer will be interrupted.

briefdescription.para: Function for activating the QSPI driver instance.

parameterdescription.para: True if activation is to be in blocking mode, false otherwise.
The driver instance has been activated.
The driver is already activated.
External memory is busy, or there are connection issues.

briefdescription.para: Function for deactivating the QSPI driver instance.

simplesect.para: If a custom instruction long transfer is ongoing when the function is called, the transfer will be interrupted.

parameterdescription.para: The driver instance has been activated.
The driver is during transaction.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if the QSPI driver is initialized.

parameterdescription.para: Driver is already initialized.
Driver is not initialized.

briefdescription.para: Function for reading data from the QSPI memory.

detaileddescription.para:
If that is the first operation after activation of driver initialization has been triggered, the activation process starts the internal clocks and the QSPI peripheral tries to read the status byte to check the busy bit. Reading the status byte is done in a simple poll and wait mechanism. If the busy bit is set, this indicates that the memory may not be ready yet. As a result, the function returns NRFX_ERROR_TIMEOUT.
Write, read, and erase operations check memory device busy state before starting the operation. If the memory is busy, the resulting action depends on the mode in which the read operation is used:
blocking mode (without handler) - a delay occurs until the last operation runs and until the operation data is being read.
interrupt mode (with handler) - event emission occurs after the last operation and reading of data are finished. In interrupt mode read operations can be double-buffered by calling the function again. To utilize double-buffering feature, NRF_QSPI_TASK_READSTART needs to be triggered on NRF_QSPI_EVENT_READY externally (for example by using the PPI/DPPI).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the receive buffer.
Size of the data to read.
Address in memory to read from.
The operation was successful (blocking mode) or operation was commissioned (handler mode).
The driver currently handles another operation.
The external memory is busy, or there are connection issues.
The provided buffer is not placed in the Data RAM region or its address is not aligned to a 32-bit word.
The operation could trigger nRF5340 anomaly 159 due to the current configuration of clocks. Refer to the errata document for more information.

briefdescription.para: Function for writing data to QSPI memory.

detaileddescription.para:
Refer to the note for nrfx_qspi_read.
Write, read, and erase operations check memory device busy state before starting the operation. If the memory is busy, the resulting action depends on the mode in which the write operation is used:
blocking mode (without handler) - a delay occurs until the last operation runs or until the operation data is being sent.
interrupt mode (with handler) - event emission occurs after the last operation and sending of operation data are finished. To manually control operation execution in the memory device, use nrfx_qspi_mem_busy_check after executing the write function. Remember that an incoming event signalizes only that data was sent to the memory device and the peripheral before the write operation checked if memory was busy. In interrupt mode write operations can be double-buffered by calling the function again. To utilize double-buffering feature, NRF_QSPI_TASK_WRITESTART needs to be triggered on NRF_QSPI_EVENT_READY externally (for example by using the PPI/DPPI).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the writing buffer.
Size of the data to write.
Address in memory to write to.
The operation was successful (blocking mode) or operation was commissioned (handler mode).
The driver currently handles other operation.
The external memory is busy, or there are connection issues.
The provided buffer is not placed in the Data RAM region or its address is not aligned to a 32-bit word.
The operation could trigger nRF5340 anomaly 159 due to the current configuration of clocks. Refer to the errata document for more information.

briefdescription.para: Function for starting erasing of one memory block - 4KB, 64KB, or the whole chip.

detaileddescription.para:
Refer to the note for nrfx_qspi_read.
Write, read, and erase operations check memory device busy state before starting the operation. If the memory is busy, the resulting action depends on the mode in which the erase operation is used:
blocking mode (without handler) - a delay occurs until the last operation runs or until the operation data is being sent.
interrupt mode (with handler) - event emission occurs after the last operation and sending of operation data are finished. To manually control operation execution in the memory device, use nrfx_qspi_mem_busy_check after executing the erase function. Remember that an incoming event signalizes only that data was sent to the memory device and the periheral before the erase operation checked if memory was busy.

parameterdescription.para: Size of data to erase. See nrf_qspi_erase_len_t.
Memory address to start erasing. If chip erase is performed, address field is ommited.
The operation was successful (blocking mode) or operation was commissioned (handler mode).
The driver currently handles another operation.
The external memory is busy, or there are connection issues.
The provided start address is not aligned to a 32-bit word.
The operation could trigger nRF5340 anomaly 159 due to the current configuration of clocks. Refer to the errata document for more information.

briefdescription.para: Function for starting an erase operation of the whole chip.

simplesect.para: Refer to the note for nrfx_qspi_read.

parameterdescription.para: The operation was successful (blocking mode) or commissioned (handler mode).
The driver currently is handling another operation.
The external memory is busy, or there are connection issues.
The operation could trigger nRF5340 anomaly 159 due to the current configuration of clocks. Refer to the errata document for more information.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the extended event associated with finished operation.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the extended event associated with finished operation.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking whether any write or read data transfer is buffered.

simplesect.para: True if there is a transfer buffered, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the current driver status and status byte of memory device with testing WIP (write in progress) bit.

parameterdescription.para: The driver and memory are ready to handle a new operation.
The driver currently is handling another operation.
The operation could trigger nRF5340 anomaly 159 due to the current configuration of clocks. Refer to the errata document for more information.

briefdescription.para: Function for signaling premature operation timeout.

detaileddescription.para: The function provides a mechanism that can cause premature timeout when the driver is waiting for the READY event. This allows to use external source of the timeout. If the driver is initialized with a handler, it will not process the event generated for the transfer.

briefdescription.para: Function for sending operation code, sending data, and receiving data from the memory device.

detaileddescription.para:
Refer to the note for nrfx_qspi_read.
Use this function to transfer configuration data to memory and to receive data from memory. Pointers can be addresses from flash memory. This function is a synchronous function and should be used only if necessary.

simplesect.para: Please note that the NRFX_QSPI_DEFAULT_CINSTR macro provides default values for the io2_level and io3_level fields that cause the IO2 and IO3 lines to be kept low during the custom instruction transfer. Such configuration may not be suitable in certain circumstances and memory devices can interpret such levels of those lines as active WP# and HOLD#/RESET# signals, respectively. Hence, it is safer to use a configuration that will keep the lines high during the transfer.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure with opcode and transfer configuration.
Pointer to the array with data to send. Can be NULL if only opcode is transmitted.
Pointer to the array for data to receive. Can be NULL if there is nothing to receive.
The operation was successful.
The external memory is busy, or there are connection issues.
The driver currently handles other operation.
The operation could trigger nRF5340 anomaly 159 due to the current configuration of clocks. Refer to the errata document for more information.

briefdescription.para: Function for sending operation code and data to the memory device with simpler configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
Refer to the note for nrfx_qspi_read.
Use this function to transfer configuration data to memory and to receive data from memory. This function is a synchronous function and should be used only if necessary.

parameterdescription.para: Operation code. Sending first.
Length of the data to send and opcode. See nrf_qspi_cinstr_len_t.
Pointer to input data array.
The operation was successful.
The driver currently handles another operation.
The external memory is busy, or there are connection issues.
The operation could trigger nRF5340 anomaly 159 due to the current configuration of clocks. Refer to the errata document for more information.

briefdescription.para: Function for starting the custom instruction long frame mode.

detaileddescription.para:
Refer to the note for nrfx_qspi_read.
The long frame mode is a mechanism that allows for arbitrary byte length custom instructions. Use this function to initiate a custom transaction by sending custom instruction opcode. To send and receive data, use nrfx_qspi_lfm_xfer.

simplesect.para: Please note that the NRFX_QSPI_DEFAULT_CINSTR macro provides default values for the io2_level and io3_level fields that cause the IO2 and IO3 lines to be kept low during the custom instruction transfer. Such configuration may not be suitable in certain circumstances and memory devices can interpret such levels of those lines as active WP# and HOLD#/RESET# signals, respectively. Hence, it is safer to use a configuration that will keep the lines high during the transfer.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the structure with custom instruction opcode and transfer configuration. Transfer length must be set to NRF_QSPI_CINSTR_LEN_1B.
Operation was successful.
Driver currently handles other operation.
The external memory is busy, or there are connection issues.
The operation could trigger nRF5340 anomaly 159 due to the current configuration of clocks. Refer to the errata document for more information.

memberdef.argsstring: (void const *p_tx_buffer, void *p_rx_buffer, size_t transfer_length, bool finalize)
memberdef.name: nrfx_qspi_lfm_xfer

briefdescription.para: Function for sending and receiving data in the custom instruction long frame mode.

detaileddescription.para:
Refer to the note for nrfx_qspi_read.
Both specified buffers must be at least transfer_length bytes in size.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the array with data to send. Can be NULL if there is nothing to send.
Pointer to the array for receiving data. Can be NULL if there is nothing to receive.
Number of bytes to send and receive.
True if custom instruction long frame mode is to be finalized after this transfer.
Operation was successful.
External memory is busy or there are connection issues. Long frame mode becomes deactivated.
The operation could trigger nRF5340 anomaly 159 due to the current configuration of clocks. Refer to the errata document for more information.

parameterdescription.para: XIP encryption configuration structure. To disable encryption, pass NULL pointer as argument.
Operation was successful.

Operation was successful.
